The changing of the term "male" to "female" in the context of sentiment prediction models has indeed had an impact on the accuracy of these predictions. This change is indicative of model bias, as the model's ability to accurately predict sentiment based on gender is compromised when using female instead of male terms. Moreover, transgender and disabled identities consistently receive lower positive sentiment scores, indicating that these groups are often overlooked or underrepresented in the data used to train these models. Therefore, it is essential to address this issue by collecting more diverse and representative data, which can help improve the accuracy of sentiment prediction models for all groups, including those who identify as transgender or disabled.
